Bank

Class Operations

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bank.Operations

  • public class Operations
extends java.lang.Object
    Operations class contains all of the tools necessary to perform banking operations including writing a check, making a deposit, withdrawing funds, making a transfer and other utilities necessary for banking like converting numbers to strings for customer output.

      • getCentsValue

        public static int getCentsValue(java.lang.String stringNumber)
        Method takes a dollar amount entered as a String, extracts any $ characters, and returns the number as an integer, i.e. the cents value of the entry
        Parameters:
        stringNumber - String representation of a dollar value
        Returns:
        integer value to represents the cents equivalent of the dollar argument

      • getDollarString

        public static java.lang.String getDollarString(int balance)
        Takes the dollar value in cents and converts it to a standard text string for numeric representation of currency in dollars
        Parameters:
        balance - the dollar value (in cents) an integer
        Returns:
        a String to represent the currency format in dollars

      • balanceToString

        public static java.lang.String balanceToString(int balance)
        The balanceToString() method is designed to take in a number up $1 million in cents, and convert that number to a String of text written in the form of a check amount description. It is a private method used as part of the writeCheck() method
        Parameters:
        balance - an integer to represent a dollar value in cents
        Returns:
        a String to represent the dollar value written in words
